title: Honor capsules feel pretty useless
body:
I am okay with honor capsules being something rare, but quite honestly I don't even care when I get them because they are so underwhelming.  I get far more key frags and BE from playing.  I get key frags all the time when i login each day and the BE amount is tiny.  It would be nice if something interesting was added in instead of just key frags and BE.  Maybe some OE, or something remotely useful.

If they really are trying to reward you for good behavior, shouldn't it actually be a reward?

The problem is that it was 'free stuff' that we all enjoyed until they decided to nerf the absolute shit out of OE.  Now it's 'free stuff earned at an abysmal rate'.  I mean, it's still free shit.  It's hard to complain about that.  They just already spoiled us with a reasonable system.  If this shit is how it was from the get-go I think there'd be a lot less complaints.

Because I have to disenchant a ludicrous amount of shards just to activate one skin I like?

How so?
What is your ideal number of free things you think you should be getting from Riot?
Or are you more of a person who's looking to unlock _**specific**_ free things?

Between My Shop, regular monthly sales and early sale discounts (50% and 1 tier bellow price respectively), Hextech chests, yearly honor + EoS rewards, mission rewards from events, etc... Where does it end for free handouts? I think Riot's running a fair number of deals for everyone and yet, players think that they should be getting Secret Santa levels of skins on a yearly basis.

You're calling three kinds of promotions "free handouts".
I don't have an opinion on the rest of your comment, just wanted to point out that something you have to pay for is, by definition, not free.

Half-off and My Shop sales are practically a steal if you manage to get a skin you really wanted for some time. That kind of a price reduction (70% on as much as a 1350 skin), is very much a good deal - provided you play that champion. It's like a Black Friday sale in League.

You can't walk into a Walmart on Black Friday and just take whatever you want for free either.
There's a reason people make such a big deal out of it.

Whether the deal is good is up to personal opinion, I imagine (except on Riot Games' side, where the only indicator is the number of sales). 
We agree at least on the fact that a promotion isn't a handout.

My point wasn't to classify what a handout and "a good deal" is by definition, my argument was about Riot already having a lot of discounts and free handouts already, where people complain about not getting exactly the things they want for free. If you want something specific, buying it directly from League's store is the most cost efficient way, rather than relying on RNG Lootboxes.

And this is especially true for their monthly 50% off sales and My Shop discounts. If you already decided to buy a skin for a champion, buying it for at least 50% off is better than buying it at a full price. In my opinion, Riot doesn't have to offer discounts and yet, they do and they've kept doing it for years.

Riot Games is a business, first and foremost.
Even if they give away free things, they have to make sure that what they do doesn't ruin their sales. It's not evil for a company to be concerned for their profit because the money they get from sales gets used to grow the company further and make better content for their products.
